GenericSection.C

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 /* Generic Sections. SgAsmGenericSection serves as a base class for all binary file formats that divide a file into contiguous
00002  * parts.  The SgAsmGenericSection class describes such a part. Most binary formats will subclass this. */
00003 
00004 #include "sage3basic.h"
00005 #include "stringify.h"
00006 #include "MemoryMap.h"
00007 
00012 void
00013 SgAsmGenericSection::ctor(SgAsmGenericFile *ef, SgAsmGenericHeader *hdr)
00014 {
00015     ROSE_ASSERT(ef != NULL);
00016 
00017     ROSE_ASSERT(p_name==NULL);
00018     p_name = new SgAsmBasicString("");
00019     p_name->set_parent(this);
00020 
00021     /* Add this section to the header's section list */
00022     if (hdr)
00023         hdr->add_section(this);
00024 }
00025 
00026 /* Destructor must remove section/header link */
00027 SgAsmGenericSection::~SgAsmGenericSection()
00028 {
00029     SgAsmGenericFile* ef = get_file();
00030     SgAsmGenericHeader *hdr = get_header();
00031 
00032     /* See constructor comment. This deletes both halves of the header/section link. */
00033     if (hdr) {
00034         hdr->remove_section(this);
00035         set_header(NULL);
00036     }
00037 
00038     /* See comment in ROSETTA/src/binaryInstruction.C.  We need to explicitly delete the section name. */
00039     if (p_name) {
00040         SageInterface::deleteAST(p_name);
00041         p_name = NULL;
00042     }
00043     
00044     /* FIXME: holes should probably be their own class, which would make the file/hole bidirectional linking more like the
00045      *        header/section bidirectional links (RPM 2008-09-02) */
00046     ef->remove_hole(this);
00047 
00048     /* Delete children */
00049     p_file   = NULL; // deleted by SageInterface::deleteAST()
00050 
00051     /* If the section has allocated its own local pool for the p_data member (rather than pointing into the SgAsmGenericFile)
00052      * then free that now. */
00053     if (local_data_pool!=NULL) {
00054         free(local_data_pool);
00055         local_data_pool = NULL;
00056     }
00057 }
00058 
00070 bool
00071 SgAsmGenericSection::align()
00072 {
00073     bool changed = false;
00074 
00075     if (get_file_alignment()>0) {
00076         rose_addr_t old_offset = get_offset();
00077         rose_addr_t new_offset = ALIGN_UP(old_offset, get_file_alignment());
00078         set_offset(new_offset);
00079         changed = changed ? true : (old_offset!=new_offset);
00080     }
00081 
00082     if (is_mapped() && get_mapped_alignment()>0) {
00083         rose_addr_t old_rva = get_mapped_preferred_rva();
00084         rose_addr_t new_rva = ALIGN_UP(old_rva, get_mapped_alignment());
00085         set_mapped_preferred_rva(new_rva);
00086         changed = changed ? true : (old_rva!=new_rva);
00087     }
00088 
00089     return changed;
00090 }
00091 
00095 void
00096 SgAsmGenericSection::grab_content()
00097 {
00098     SgAsmGenericFile *ef = get_file();
00099     ROSE_ASSERT(ef);
00100 
00101     if (get_offset()<=ef->get_orig_size()) {
00102         if (get_offset()+get_size()<=ef->get_orig_size()) {
00103             p_data = ef->content(get_offset(), get_size());
00104         } else {
00105             p_data = ef->content(get_offset(), ef->get_orig_size()-get_offset());
00106         }
00107     }
00108 }
00109 
00115 unsigned char *
00116 SgAsmGenericSection::writable_content(size_t nbytes)
00117 {
00118     if (local_data_pool!=NULL)
00119         free(local_data_pool);
00120     local_data_pool = (unsigned char*)calloc(nbytes, 1);
00121     p_data = SgSharedVector<unsigned char>(local_data_pool, nbytes);
00122     return &(p_data[0]);
00123 }

00134 void
00135 SgAsmGenericSection::set_name(SgAsmGenericString *s)
00136 {
00137     if (s!=p_name) {
00138         if (p_name) {
00139             p_name->set_parent(NULL);
00140             SageInterface::deleteAST(p_name);
00141         }
00142         p_name = s;
00143         if (p_name)
00144             p_name->set_parent(this);
00145         set_isModified(true);
00146     }
00147 }

00324 size_t
00325 SgAsmGenericSection::read_content(const MemoryMap *map, rose_addr_t start_rva, void *dst_buf, rose_addr_t size, bool strict)

00334 
00339 size_t
00340 SgAsmGenericSection::read_content_local(rose_addr_t start_offset, void *dst_buf, rose_addr_t size, bool strict)
00341 {
00342     size_t retval;
00343     SgAsmGenericFile *file = get_file();
00344     ROSE_ASSERT(file!=NULL);
00345     if (start_offset > get_size()) {
00346         if (strict)
00347             throw ShortRead(this, start_offset, size);
00348         retval = 0;
00349     } else if (start_offset+size > get_size()) {
00350         if (strict)
00351             throw ShortRead(this, get_size(), start_offset+size-get_size());
00352         retval = get_size() - start_offset;
00353     } else {
00354         retval = size;
00355     }
00356 
00357     file->read_content(get_offset()+start_offset, dst_buf, retval, true);
00358     memset((char*)dst_buf+retval, 0, size-retval);
00359     return retval;
00360 }
00361 
00364 SgUnsignedCharList
00365 SgAsmGenericSection::read_content_local_ucl(rose_addr_t rel_offset, rose_addr_t size)
00366 {
00367     SgUnsignedCharList retval;
00368     unsigned char *buf = new unsigned char[size];
00369     read_content_local(rel_offset, buf, size, false); /*zero pads; never throws*/
00370     for (size_t i=0; i<size; i++)
00371         retval.push_back(buf[i]);
00372     delete[] buf;
00373     return retval;
00374 }

00401 
00405 std::string
00406 SgAsmGenericSection::read_content_local_str(rose_addr_t rel_offset, bool strict)
00407 {
00408     static char *buf=NULL;
00409     static size_t nalloc=0;
00410     size_t nused=0;
00411 
00412     while (1) {
00413         if (nused >= nalloc) {
00414             nalloc = std::max((size_t)32, 2*nalloc);
00415             buf = (char*)realloc(buf, nalloc);
00416             ROSE_ASSERT(buf!=NULL);
00417         }
00418 
00419         unsigned char byte;
00420         read_content_local(rel_offset+nused, &byte, 1, strict);
00421         if (!byte)
00422             return std::string(buf, nused);
00423         buf[nused++] = byte;
00424     }
00425 }
00426 
00430 uint64_t
00431 SgAsmGenericSection::read_content_local_uleb128(rose_addr_t *rel_offset, bool strict)
00432 {
00433     int shift=0;
00434     uint64_t retval=0;
00435     while (1) {
00436         unsigned char byte;
00437         read_content_local(*rel_offset, &byte, 1, strict);
00438         *rel_offset += 1;
00439         ROSE_ASSERT(shift<64);
00440         retval |= (byte & 0x7f) << shift;
00441         shift += 7;
00442         if (0==(byte & 0x80))
00443             break;
00444     }
00445     return retval;
00446 }
00447 
00451 int64_t
00452 SgAsmGenericSection::read_content_local_sleb128(rose_addr_t *rel_offset, bool strict)
00453 {
00454     int shift=0;
00455     int64_t retval=0;
00456     while (1) {
00457         unsigned char byte;
00458         read_content_local(*rel_offset, &byte, 1, strict);
00459         *rel_offset += 1;
00460         ROSE_ASSERT(shift<64);
00461         retval |= (byte & 0x7f) << shift;
00462         shift += 7;
00463         if (0==(byte & 0x80))
00464             break;
00465     }
00466     retval = (retval << (64-shift)) >> (64-shift); /*sign extend*/
00467     return retval;
00468 }
00469 
00483 rose_addr_t
00484 SgAsmGenericSection::write(std::ostream &f, rose_addr_t offset, size_t bufsize, const void *buf) const
00485 {
00486     size_t nwrite, nzero;
00487 
00488     ROSE_ASSERT(this != NULL);
00489 
00490     /* Don't write past end of section */
00491     if (offset>=get_size()) {
00492         nwrite = 0;
00493         nzero  = bufsize;
00494     } else if (offset+bufsize<=get_size()) {
00495         nwrite = bufsize;
00496         nzero = 0;
00497     } else {
00498         nwrite = get_size() - offset;
00499         nzero = bufsize - nwrite;
00500     }
00501 
00502     /* Don't write past end of current EOF if we can help it. */
00503     f.seekp(0, std::ios::end);
00504     rose_addr_t filesize = f.tellp();
00505     while (nwrite>0 && 0==((const char*)buf)[nwrite-1] && get_offset()+offset+nwrite>filesize)
00506         --nwrite;
00507 
00508     /* Write bytes to file. This is a good place to set a break point if you're trying to figure out what section is writing
00509      * to a particular file address. For instance, if byte 0x7c is incorrect in the unparsed file you would set a conditional
00510      * breakpoint for o<=0x7c && o+nwrite>0x7c */
00511     ROSE_ASSERT(f);
00512     off_t o = get_offset() + offset;
00513     f.seekp(o);
00514     ROSE_ASSERT(f);
00515     f.write((const char*)buf, nwrite);
00516     ROSE_ASSERT(f);
00517 
00518     /* Check that truncated data is all zero and fail if it isn't */
00519     for (size_t i=nwrite; i<bufsize; i++) {
00520         if (((const char*)buf)[i]) {
00521             char mesg[1024];
00522             sprintf(mesg, "non-zero value truncated: buf[0x%zx]=0x%02x", i, ((const unsigned char*)buf)[i]);
00523             fprintf(stderr, "SgAsmGenericSection::write: error: %s", mesg);
00524             fprintf(stderr, " in [%d] \"%s\"\n", get_id(), get_name()->get_string(true).c_str());
00525             fprintf(stderr, "    section is at file offset 0x%08"PRIx64" (%"PRIu64"), size 0x%"PRIx64" (%"PRIu64") bytes\n", 
00526                     get_offset(), get_offset(), get_size(), get_size());
00527             fprintf(stderr, " write %zu byte%s at section offset 0x%08"PRIx64"\n", bufsize, 1==bufsize?"":"s", offset);
00528             fprintf(stderr, "      ");
00529             HexdumpFormat hf;
00530             hf.prefix = "      ";
00531             hexdump(stderr, get_offset()+offset, (const unsigned char*)buf, bufsize, hf);
00532             fprintf(stderr, "\n");
00533             throw SgAsmGenericFile::ShortWrite(this, offset, bufsize, mesg);
00534         }
00535     }
00536 
00537     return offset+bufsize;
00538 }

00571 
00573 rose_addr_t
00574 SgAsmGenericSection::write_uleb128(unsigned char *buf, rose_addr_t offset, uint64_t val) const
00575 {
00576     if (val==0) {
00577         buf[offset++] = 0;
00578     } else {
00579         while (val) {
00580             unsigned char byte = val & 0x7f;
00581             val >>= 7;
00582             if (val!=0)
00583                 byte |= 0x80;
00584             buf[offset++] = byte;
00585         }
00586     }
00587     return offset;
00588 }
00589 
00591 rose_addr_t
00592 SgAsmGenericSection::write_sleb128(unsigned char *buf, rose_addr_t offset, int64_t val) const
00593 {
00594     if (val==0) {
00595         buf[offset++] = 0;
00596     } else if (val==-1) {
00597         buf[offset++] = 0x7f;
00598     } else {
00599         while (val!=0 && val!=-1) {
00600             unsigned char byte = (uint64_t)val & 0x7f;
00601             val >>= 7; /*sign extending*/
00602             if (val!=0 && val!=-1)
00603                 byte |= 0x80;
00604             buf[offset++] = byte;
00605         }
00606     }
00607     return offset;
00608 }
00609 
00612 ExtentMap
00613 SgAsmGenericSection::get_referenced_extents() const
00614 {
00615     ExtentMap retval;
00616     if (0==get_size())
00617         return retval;
00618 
00619     Extent s(get_offset(), get_size());
00620     const ExtentMap &file_extents = get_file()->get_referenced_extents();
00621     for (ExtentMap::const_iterator i=file_extents.begin(); i!=file_extents.end(); i++) {
00622         Extent e = i->first;
00623         if (e.contained_in(s)) {
00624             retval.insert(Extent(e.first()-get_offset(), e.size()));
00625         } else if (e.left_of(s) || e.right_of(s)) {
00626             /*void*/
00627         } else if (e.contains(s)) {
00628             retval.insert(Extent(0, get_size()));
00629         } else if (e.begins_before(s)) {
00630             retval.insert(Extent(0, e.first()+e.size()-get_offset()));
00631         } else if (e.ends_after(s)) {
00632             retval.insert(Extent(e.first()-get_offset(), get_offset()+get_size()-e.first()));
00633         } else {
00634             assert(!"invalid extent overlap category");
00635             abort();
00636         }
00637     }
00638     return retval;
00639 }
00640 
00641 ExtentMap
00642 SgAsmGenericSection::get_unreferenced_extents() const
00643 {
00644     return get_referenced_extents().subtract_from(Extent(0, get_size())); /*complement*/
00645 }
00646 
00652 void
00653 SgAsmGenericSection::extend(rose_addr_t size)
00654 {
00655     ROSE_ASSERT(get_file() != NULL);
00656     ROSE_ASSERT(get_file()->get_tracking_references()); /*can only be called during the parsing phase*/
00657     rose_addr_t new_size = get_size() + size;
00658 
00659     /* Ending file address for section using new size, limited by total file size */
00660     rose_addr_t new_end = std::min(get_file()->get_orig_size(), get_offset()+new_size);
00661     if (get_offset()<=new_end) {
00662         p_data.resize(new_end-get_offset());
00663     } else {
00664         ROSE_ASSERT(0==p_data.size());
00665     }
00666 
00667     if (p_size!=new_size)
00668         set_isModified(true);
00669     p_size = new_size;
00670 }
00671 
00673 SgAsmGenericHeader *
00674 SgAsmGenericSection::is_file_header()
00675 {
00676     try {
00677         SgAsmGenericHeader *retval = dynamic_cast<SgAsmGenericHeader*>(this);
00678         return retval;
00679     } catch(...) {
00680         return NULL;
00681     }
00682 }

00686 void
00687 SgAsmGenericSection::unparse(std::ostream &f) const
00688 {
00689 #if 0
00690     /* FIXME: for now we print the names of all sections we dump using this method. Eventually most of these sections will
00691      *        have subclasses that override this method. */
00692     fprintf(stderr, "SgAsmGenericSection::unparse(FILE*) for section [%d] \"%s\"\n", id, name.c_str());
00693 #endif
00694 
00695     write(f, 0, p_data);
00696 }
00697 
00699 void
00700 SgAsmGenericSection::unparse(std::ostream &f, const ExtentMap &map) const
00701 {
00702     for (ExtentMap::const_iterator i=map.begin(); i!=map.end(); ++i) {
00703         Extent e = i->first;
00704         assert(e.first()+e.size() <= get_size());
00705         const unsigned char *extent_data;
00706         size_t nwrite;
00707         if (e.first() >= p_data.size()) {
00708             extent_data = NULL;
00709             nwrite = 0;
00710         } else if (e.first() + e.size() > p_data.size()) {
00711             extent_data = &p_data[e.first()];
00712             nwrite = p_data.size() - e.first();
00713         } else {
00714             extent_data = &p_data[e.first()];
00715             nwrite = e.size();
00716         }
00717         if (extent_data)
00718             write(f, e.first(), e.size(), extent_data);
00719     }
00720 }

00729     holes.dump_extents(stderr, "  ", "");

00742 
00746 rose_addr_t
00747 SgAsmGenericSection::get_va_offset(rose_addr_t va) const
00748 {
00749     ROSE_ASSERT(is_mapped());
00750     ROSE_ASSERT(va >= get_base_va());
00751     rose_addr_t rva = va - get_base_va();
00752     ROSE_ASSERT(rva >= get_mapped_preferred_rva());
00753     return get_offset() + (rva - get_mapped_preferred_rva());
00754 }
00755 
00757 void
00758 SgAsmGenericSection::dump_containing_sections(FILE *f, const std::string &prefix, rose_rva_t rva,
00759                                               const SgAsmGenericSectionPtrList &slist)
00760 {
00761     for (size_t i=0; i<slist.size(); i++) {
00762         SgAsmGenericSection *s = slist[i];
00763         if (s->is_mapped() && rva>=s->get_mapped_preferred_rva() && rva<s->get_mapped_preferred_rva()+s->get_mapped_size()) {
00764             rose_addr_t offset = rva - s->get_mapped_preferred_rva();
00765             fprintf(f, "%-*s   is 0x%08"PRIx64" (%"PRIu64") bytes into section [%d] \"%s\"\n",
00766                     DUMP_FIELD_WIDTH, prefix.c_str(), offset, offset, s->get_id(), s->get_name()->get_string(true).c_str());
00767         }
00768     }
00769 }
00770 
00771 /* Print some debugging info */
00772 void
00773 SgAsmGenericSection::dump(FILE *f, const char *prefix, ssize_t idx) const
00774 {
00775     char p[4096];
00776     if (idx>=0) {
00777         sprintf(p, "%sSection[%zd].", prefix, idx);
00778     } else {
00779         sprintf(p, "%sSection.", prefix);
00780     }
00781     
00782     const int w = std::max(1, DUMP_FIELD_WIDTH-(int)strlen(p));
00783 
00784     fprintf(f, "%s%-*s = \"%s\"",                      p, w, "name",        p_name->get_string(true).c_str());
00785     if (!p_short_name.empty())
00786         fprintf(f, " (%s)", p_short_name.c_str());
00787     fprintf(f, "\n");
00788     fprintf(f, "%s%-*s = %d\n",                          p, w, "id",          p_id);
00789     fprintf(f, "%s%-*s = 0x%08"PRIx64" (%"PRIu64") bytes into file\n", p, w, "offset", p_offset, p_offset);
00790     fprintf(f, "%s%-*s = 0x%08"PRIx64" (%"PRIu64") bytes\n",           p, w, "size", get_size(), get_size());
00791     if (0==get_file_alignment()) {
00792         fprintf(f, "%s%-*s = not specified\n", p, w, "file_alignment");
00793     } else {
00794         fprintf(f, "%s%-*s = 0x%08"PRIx64" (%"PRIu64") %s\n", p, w, "file_alignment", 
00795                 get_file_alignment(), get_file_alignment(),
00796                 0==get_offset()%get_file_alignment()?"satisfied":"NOT SATISFIED");
00797     }
00798     fprintf(f, "%s%-*s = %s\n",                          p, w, "synthesized", p_synthesized?"yes":"no");
00799     if (p_header) {
00800         fprintf(f, "%s%-*s = \"%s\"\n",                  p, w, "header",      p_header->get_name()->get_string(true).c_str());
00801     } else {
00802         fprintf(f, "%s%-*s = not associated\n",          p, w, "header");
00803     }
00804     
00805     std::string purpose = stringifySgAsmGenericSectionSectionPurpose(p_purpose);
00806     fprintf(f, "%s%-*s = %s\n", p, w, "purpose", purpose.c_str());
00807 
00808     if (is_mapped()) {
00809         fprintf(f, "%s%-*s = rva=0x%08"PRIx64", size=%"PRIu64" bytes\n", p, w, "mapped",  p_mapped_preferred_rva, p_mapped_size);
00810         if (0==get_mapped_alignment()) {
00811             fprintf(f, "%s%-*s = not specified\n", p, w, "mapped_alignment");
00812         } else {
00813             fprintf(f, "%s%-*s = 0x%08"PRIx64" (%"PRIu64") %s\n", p, w, "mapped_alignment", 
00814                     get_mapped_alignment(), get_mapped_alignment(),
00815                     0==get_mapped_preferred_rva()%get_mapped_alignment()?"satisfied":"NOT SATISFIED");
00816         }
00817         fprintf(f, "%s%-*s = %c%c%c\n", p, w, "permissions",
00818                 get_mapped_rperm()?'r':'-', get_mapped_wperm()?'w':'-', get_mapped_xperm()?'x':'-');
00819     } else {
00820         fprintf(f, "%s%-*s = <not mapped>\n",    p, w, "mapped");
00821     }
00822 
00823     fprintf(f, "%s%-*s = %s\n", p, w, "contains_code", get_contains_code()?"true":"false");
00824     fprintf(f, "%s%-*s = 0x%08"PRIx64" (%"PRIu64") \n", p, w, "mapped_actual_va", p_mapped_actual_va, p_mapped_actual_va);
00825 
00826     // DQ (8/31/2008): Output the contents if this not derived from (there is likely a 
00827     // better implementation if the hexdump function was a virtual member function).
00828     if (variantT() == V_SgAsmGenericSection) {
00829         hexdump(f, 0, std::string(p)+"data at ", p_data);
00830     }
00831 }
